conclusion: Analyze interaction between car and squares considering power, collision, and deflection.
Car (A) enters from the lower right corner and moves towards the left.
Car will likely collide with the red square due to direction of movement.
Collision with red square transfers kinetic energy and deflects car slightly upwards.
Car will move towards the green squares after red square.
Collision with first green square transfers energy and deflects car further upwards.
Car will likely collide with the second green square.
Collision with second green square transfers energy and deflects car further upwards and slightly to the left.
Car moves towards the blue square.
Collision with blue square transfers energy and deflects car upwards and to the left.
Final collision with purple square transfers remaining energy and deflects car upwards and to the left.
Car will eventually stop near the purple square, slightly above and to the left of its initial path.
Toy car (A) stops near the purple square after deflections through collisions with squares.
